text.author: Santa Barbara Corpus of Spoken American English (ed. John W. Du Bois)
text.title: Shaggy Dog Story
text.summary: The owner of some paintings shows them to someone and tells how his wife fell in love with art by Jewish Mexican artist Leonardo Nierman on a trip to Mexico twenty five years ago, where they bought a painting of a Mexican woman with a watermelon on her head for $30, and recounts how his father-in-law bought him his first piece of art, by Geri Rae, for his office.
